results.content:
This course is accessible and gives information that are factual and easy to to understand (even to a newbie like me).
The content of the technical part is easy to understand and straightforward  making the course a great way to learn : first a part that explains the nature of the "code", then an example of application of the "code" ("code" is for all the different types : modals, interfaces, and so on).
I highly recommend this course

results.content: I started doing my MEAN stack project under my University professor and even though i knew Mongo, Express and NodeJS, initially i hade no idea about Angular. I quickly learned that typescript is at heart of Angular and mastering it became my goal. This course certainly provides the basic foundation and much more with immediate implementation in the project after learning the concept. This experience helped me a lot.

I quickly learned that typescript is at heart of Angular and mastering it became my goal. This course certainly provides the basic foundation and much more with immediate implementation in the project after learning the concept. This experience helped me a lot.

results.content:
El contenido es más o menos el que me esperaba, salvo por una cuestión: TypeScript es un lenguaje compilado. Para mí, como para muchos, esto es más bien una desventaja ya que se está añadiendo un proceso adicional al renderizado que no hacía falta. Y esto no se menciona en el vídeo. Por otro lado, el hecho que que haya sido creado por Microsoft, desde la perspectiva del software libre, está lejos de ser una ventaja.
Por otro lado, considero que no costaría nada incluir subtítulos en otros idiomas, como por ejemplo el castellano.

response.content: The reason we use Typescript is because it makes our code so much cleaner, succinct and readable then using ES5 Javascript. We're still producing ES5 code so there is no extra 'rendering' or 'processing' when the code is being delivered and read by the browser.
response.content_html: The reason we use Typescript is because it makes our code so much cleaner, succinct and readable then using ES5 Javascript. We're still producing ES5 code so there is no extra 'rendering' or 'processing' when the code is being delivered and read by the browser.

results.content_html:

Para mí, como para muchos, esto es más bien una desventaja ya que se está añadiendo un proceso adicional al renderizado que no hacía falta. Y esto no se menciona en el vídeo. Por otro lado, el hecho que que haya sido creado por Microsoft, desde la perspectiva del software libre, está lejos de ser una ventaja.
Por otro lado, considero que no costaría nada incluir subtítulos en otros idiomas, como por ejemplo el castellano.

results.content:
I really didn't like this course. I got up to 37% and really couldn't push myself any further. In the Instructor's defence, Angular does have a lot of new terms and jargon associated with it - this is why I have given 2.5 stars.

The instructor needs to learn more about teaching i.e. what are the knowledge assumptions I can comfortably make to teach this course for beginners? How does one convey technical information in a pragmatic way that makes new knowledge stick? (for example, talking about why things are the way they are, rather than just spewing information in a verbose way)
results.content_html:
I really didn't like this course. I got up to 37% and really couldn't push myself any further. In the Instructor's defence, Angular does have a lot of new terms and jargon associated with it - this is why I have given 2.5 stars.

The instructor needs to learn more about teaching i.e. what are the knowledge assumptions I can comfortably make to teach this course for beginners? How does one convey technical information in a pragmatic way that makes new knowledge stick? (for example, talking about why things are the way they are, rather than just spewing information in a verbose way)

results.content:
El curso sirve como iniciación a Angular. Es corto, por lo que no se profundiza en detalle en ninguna lección, pero abarca lo básico de Angular para que puedas investigar por tu cuenta apoyándote en los recursos que proporciona.

El profesor explica despacio y se le entiende muy bien.

Los materiales aportados son suficientes para seguir el curso y poder investigar después.

Quizá echo en falta más ejercicios prácticos para hacer de forma individual. En ocasiones es más fácil implementar una necesidad de otro que una propia.
results.content_html:
El curso sirve como iniciación a Angular. Es corto, por lo que no se profundiza en detalle en ninguna lección, pero abarca lo básico de Angular para que puedas investigar por tu cuenta apoyándote en los recursos que proporciona.

El profesor explica despacio y se le entiende muy bien.

Los materiales aportados son suficientes para seguir el curso y poder investigar después.

Quizá echo en falta más ejercicios prácticos para hacer de forma individual. En ocasiones es más fácil implementar una necesidad de otro que una propia.

results.content: The course was very informative, but the "Service's" module seemed to be missing a chapter.  That is, at the end of the introduction to Services the instructor stated lets go through an example of creating a Service, but not example was given.  But all in all this course was very helpful as an introduction to Angular 2.

response.content: Hi Mark, the services example is being added now.  I'm still working on adding a few more sections to this course.
response.content_html: Hi Mark, the services example is being added now. I'm still working on adding a few more sections to this course.

results.content:

I wish there were more exercises and in-depth explanations.
results.content_html:
Good course! It will definitely help you to get started and give you insights to continue learning on your own.

results.content:
The beginning setup section was all over the place. It wasn't clear that the instructor had switched to working with a different project directory.

A lot of cutting and pasting instead of doing things from scratch cheapened the experience by making it feel less personal. 

Instead of applying some examples tastefully/elegantly into the project, they were just shoved into place, making the page look like garbage.

It would have been nice to explain what other angular features could be used.

Explaining Observable's behavior would have been nice.
results.content_html:
The beginning setup section was all over the place. It wasn't clear that the instructor had switched to working with a different project directory.

A lot of cutting and pasting instead of doing things from scratch cheapened the experience by making it feel less personal.

Instead of applying some examples tastefully/elegantly into the project, they were just shoved into place, making the page look like garbage.

It would have been nice to explain what other angular features could be used.

Explaining Observable's behavior would have been nice.

results.content:
El contenido es claro y está bien explicado, sobre todo hasta mitad del curso.
La última parte, que es la más complicada, se explica sin demasiados detalles, y hace que no se entienda todo lo bien que se debe.
Por último, deja algo muy importante por explicar, que es como llevar la aplicación una vez terminada a un servidor web real (desplegar solo el HTML, CSS y Javascript), que tendré que buscar aparte.
results.content_html:

results.content: Great introduction, very precise explanations. The course won't make you an Angular 2 expert but you will have a good understanding of the framework's philosophy. Many useful slides one can take a print-screen of.
results.content_html: Great introduction, very precise explanations. The course won't make you an Angular 2 expert but you will have a good understanding of the framework's philosophy. Many useful slides one can take a print-screen of.

results.content: you explain the topic really well, I never learn angular before and i can understand the topic and i tried to implement it.
results.content_html: you explain the topic really well, I never learn angular before and i can understand the topic and i tried to implement it.

results.content:
Got this course for free and it's well worth the money! :) Seriously - thanks for this. I used to program Angular 1 and was looking to quickly get up to speed.

That said the material here is out of date (latest Angular is now v6 and that's what I was going for). First I tried running straight on the latest and fixing errors but it was a mess. So I went the other way, created an Angular 6 template app and implemented the sections as the course went along. This worked very well and forced me to think, read documentation and use the latest API (esp HttpClient) instead of just lazily following along.

So again thanks for making this course available.
results.content_html:
Got this course for free and it's well worth the money! :) Seriously - thanks for this. I used to program Angular 1 and was looking to quickly get up to speed.

That said the material here is out of date (latest Angular is now v6 and that's what I was going for). First I tried running straight on the latest and fixing errors but it was a mess. So I went the other way, created an Angular 6 template app and implemented the sections as the course went along. This worked very well and forced me to think, read documentation and use the latest API (esp HttpClient) instead of just lazily following along.

So again thanks for making this course available.
